title: Add Reference Website URL capture for redesign matching a provided website

requirements.text: Add an admin-only feature to capture and persist a single “Reference Website” URL (the site the user wants to emulate) and optional design notes, so future UI work can explicitly target that reference.

quotes: I am giving you a link to a website, can you make one like that?

acceptanceCriteria: A new admin-only page is available from the Admin Dashboard (and/or existing admin navigation) labeled in English as “Reference Website”.
The page contains: (1) a required URL field, (2) an optional multi-line notes field, and (3) Save/Cancel actions.
Saving persists the URL/notes in the backend canister and is only allowed for admins; non-admin callers are rejected.
The saved URL is displayed on the page after reload and includes a safe “Open link” action that opens in a new tab.
The page shows clear loading and error states and does not crash on backend failures.

requirements.text: Expose the saved Reference Website URL (read-only) somewhere in the existing admin area as a reminder for future redesign work (e.g., a small card/section on the Admin Dashboard or on the Planned Features page).

quotes: I am giving you a link to a website, can you make one like that?

acceptanceCriteria: When an admin has saved a Reference Website URL, the admin area shows the URL in a read-only display and provides an “Open link” action.
If no Reference Website URL has been saved yet, the admin area shows a short English placeholder message indicating that the reference link has not been set.
This display is not visible to non-admin users.

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
Only generate backend/migration.mo if state schema changes require conditional migration for existing deployments.
Do not edit any frontend files under the immutablePaths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Do not introduce external databases or third-party auth; keep admin auth as currently implemented (Internet Identity-based).
Use English for any new user-facing text introduced by this build request.
nonGoals: Do not implement the full visual redesign to match the reference website yet (that requires the actual URL and explicit design targets).
Do not add image upload or scraping/crawling of the reference website.
Do not change existing product, order, i18n, or admin-auth flows beyond adding this new reference-link capture/display.
